result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. SKATTEBO was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Morphine), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No association with any known drug users or dealers.

timeConds.notes:
Nine (9) months, up front, under the Huber Law. 
Three (3) months, stayed to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer of second and subsequent offense on Count 1.  Motion granted.  
Count 1 - Possess Morphine - No contest plea.   Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, disorderly conduct and count 3, possess drug paraphernalia.   Motion granted.  Sentencing hearing is set for 10-13-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Court orders defendant to provide DNA sample.   
$50.00 cash bail from 15 CF 13, $100.00 cash bail from 15 CF 355 and $50.00 cash bail from 15 CF 144 added to this case, total bail $200.00.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes.

Plea date is set for 09-24-15 at 1:15 p.m.
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L. SKATTEBO
Current: 2319 12th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 1607 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States
Letter from Judge Rohrer to Attorney Ritter dated 07-13-15 with unsigned order to transport attached.
Letter from Attorney Ritter to Judge Rohrer dated 07-09-15.

The matters were set for a plea hearing today. Attorney Ritter informs the Court that the defendant does not want to proceed to a plea and sentencing and wants these matters set for jury trial.
Attorney Ritter also feels he has an ethical duty to inform the court that he is raising the issue of competency  at this time.  The defendant seems to be having a hard time understanding the legal procedure involved with these matters.  He asks the Court to order a competency evaluation.
The Court orders a competency examination of the defendant on all pending files, even the two that are Judge Fox's  and orders the Wisconsin Forensic Unit to conduct the examination.
The Court will draft the necessary order.
(Per Robbie, Judge Fox's cases will just ride along with Branch 1's files.  No specific competency order needs to be done on those two cases)
